alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 6:34AM PDT until June 14 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Grande Ronde River at Troy affecting Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties, Wallowa County and Northeast Blue Mountains zones. .Some light rain is expected to continue across the northern Blue Mountains through the morning and then turn to showers in the afternoon. For the lower Grande Ronde River...including Troy...flooding is possible. Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Grande Ronde River Troy 10.0 9.6 Mon 6 am PDT 9.9 8.9 8.2 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ORZ050-WAZ031-032-132330- /O.EXT.KPDT.FL.A.0004.000000T0000Z-220614T2330Z/ /TRYO3.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.UU/ 634 AM PDT Mon Jun 13 2022 ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...For the lower Grande Ronde River at Troy. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding of fields adjacent to the river from Elgin through Troy and downstream to the confluence of the Snake River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM PDT Monday the river stage at Troy was 9.6 feet. - The river is expected to continue rising and cresting near 10.0 feet at the Troy river gage tonight. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains
